summary: Northman Armours - Currently 2 armours of Norse influence
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i1083.photobucket.com/albums/j398/ActusReus/Mod%20Titles/NorthmanArmours.png[/img]

[url=http://p3d.in/EOM5j]3D Preview - Northern Light Armour[/url]

[url=http://p3d.in/EVfhb]3D Preview - Northern Knight[/url]

Northman Armour is a StandAlone release of the [url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/798555-credo-wip/]Credo - WIP[/url]

This mod adds 2 unique armours to the game: 

Heavy: The armour is the equivalent of Steel armour stat wise. They are craft-able, you can also temper the armour like any other and the ingredients again are the same as crafting standard versions of the armour.

Light: The armour is the equivalent of leather armour stat wise. They are craft-able, you can also temper the armour like any other and the ingredients again are the same as crafting standard versions of the armour.

There are NO resources used from Dawnguard whatsoever, the armour has been created by my self using a variety of components from the Witcher 2 armours legally ported over to Skyrim, by the wonderful L0rd0fWar and AlphaWolf, and of course the fur shoulder part from Nivea\'s superb mod [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13486]Winter is Coming - Cloaks[/url]

[youtube]E7z23vLW7W8[/youtube][youtube]NijXIXQNlt0[/youtube][youtube]DeIxWTfCJ_4[/youtube]

VERSION HISTORY:

Version 1.5: Normal map issues resolved and missing texture with inventory item for light armour fixed..

NEW Northman Armour\'s: New file new version currently 1.0 as this is more of a sequel, I just didnt wish to upload a new mod, rather keep it all here.. 2 armours in the pack now, maybe more in the future and some lovely Norse weapons to..

Version 2.0: Some of you will have downloaded the previous file, please remove both \"Credo\" folders one in your Meshes folder and the other in your Textures folder and delete the NorthmanArmour esp file. You will then be able to download version 3.0 without any issues.

FIXED: 1st Person view bug

ADDED: Male version of armour is now available for female characters

[img]http://i1083.photobucket.com/albums/j398/ActusReus/Mod%20Titles/Installation.png[/img]

YOU MUST HAVE SKYRIM UPDATED TO 1.8 FOR THIS MOD TO WORK

Please make sure you delete the previous version of this mod BEFORE installing v3.0 then:

Copy the data folder into your game directory.. Yes to merge folders..

With steam this will be:

C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\

[img]http://i1083.photobucket.com/albums/j398/ActusReus/Mod%20Titles/Credits.png[/img]

Dejawolf for the superb Helm, mesh and texture 

L0rd0fWar and AlphaWolf for their hard work porting Witcher 2 assets

Nivea for permission to use her wonderful fur mesh and texture

Nightasy for his essential tutorial videos - [url=http://nightasy.com/index.php]Nightasy Website[/url]

CD Project RED for the Witcher 2

Bethesda for Skyrim and the CK

All CK work, skinnig/rigging, customisation of components used and re-texture work done by my self

[img]http://i1083.photobucket.com/albums/j398/ActusReus/Mod%20Titles/Permissions.png[/img]


Assets assembled into the new model by my self are free to use with out requesting permission, with the following exeptions:

1- Any assets I have been granted permission to use in the creation of this mod, will need to have permission requested from you
if you wish to use them.

Nivea MUST be asked before the fur mesh and texture are used for any public release.

2- Credit must be given to Dejawolf from the TaleWorlds forums for his creation of the Helm mesh and texture.

I would also just hope to be credited if you use any parts of any of my mods.

[img]http://i1083.photobucket.com/albums/j398/ActusReus/Mod%20Titles/OtherMods.png[/img]
[color=\"#FFA500\"][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26313]Plates Armours[/url][/color]
[color=\"#FFA500\"][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26904/]Cleric Armours[/url][/color]

Thank you and I hope you enjoy.

Actus[/center]
author: ActusReus
